item.title: Foreign fund flow into Bangladesh corporates falls to $9.80b until Nov
item.description: Corporate external borrowing drops as persisting economic sluggishness dampens businesses' appetite for funds with the short-term overseas debt stock having declined to $9.80 billion until November. Officials and money-market analysts see such unrelenting contraction in private-sector foreign debt

item.title: Migratory birds throng Ctg seashore, riverbanks
item.description: The weather has been chilly in the port-city for the last several days. A number of migratory and guest birds have now gathered in the seashore areas as well as on the banks of rivers including Karnaphuli, Sangu and Halda. Bird-lovers are going to the areas along the banks of Karnaphuli River to w

item.title: Temp dips to 6.8Â°C in Panchagarh as cold spell prevails
item.description: The cold wave and dense fog are likely to persist for several more days across the country, according to the Bangladesh Meteorological Department (BMD). The overall weather situation would remain dry with a temporary partly cloudy sky during the next 24 hours, commencing from 9:00am Friday, said t

item.title: Two-day photo exhibition on Khaleda Zia in capital
item.description: A two-day photo exhibition focusing on the eventful and struggling life of BNP Chairperson and former prime minister Begum Khaleda Zia began at Zia Udyan in the capital on Friday.Political Biography Book BNP Standing Committee Member Nazrul Islam Khan inaugurated the exhibition, organised by Bogur

item.title: 12th Commencement Ceremony of AUW today
item.description: The 12th Commencement Ceremony of the Asian University for Women (AUW) will be held at Radisson Blu Hotel in the port-city today (Saturday) with its Chancellor Cherie Blair in the chair. Professor Irene Tracey, Vice Chancellor of the University of Oxford, UK, will attend the function as the speaker

item.title: DU holds int'l conference on Islamic Finance, Banking
item.description: The Dhaka University (DU) has organised a two-day international conference on Islamic Finance and Banking under the theme 'Islamic Finance for Sustainable Economic Development'. The event is jointly organised by the DU Department of Finance and the Central Shariah Board for Islamic Banks of Bangla

item.title: Loan distributions: MoF asks specialised banks to stay within mandates
item.description: The Ministry of Finance (MoF) has instructed specialised banks to distribute loans according to their mandates after it was found that they were going beyond their authorised areas. Officials say the specialised banks were formed with the target to make loans available in some special sectors, esp

item.title: Four DU professors face charge over roles during July Uprising
item.description: The Dhaka University (DU) administration has decided to frame charges against four professors of the Department of Sociology and form a probe committee over their alleged roles during the July 2024 mass uprising. The accused teachers are Prof Jinat Huda, Prof AKM Jamal Uddin, Prof Sadeka Halim, an

item.title: Price of .bd domain cut by 36pc
item.description: The price of Bangladesh's country code top-level domain .bd has been reduced by 36 per cent following a second round of review, Special Assistant to the Chief Adviser Faiz Ahmad Taiyeb announced on Friday. In a Facebook post, Faiz Ahmad Taiyeb said the decision was taken in response to application

item.title: Protests over Musabbir killing continue
item.description: Protests continued in the city on Friday over the killing of Jatiyatabadi Swecchasebak Dal leader Azizur Rahman Musabbir. People from all walks of life staged protests at Farmgate and Karwan Bazar areas in the city, demanding immediate justice for the slain leader. Supporters of Musabbir organise

item.title: EC begins hearing appeals against nomination decisions today
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) is scheduled to begin hearing and resolving appeals today (Saturday) from candidates whose nomination papers were rejected by the returning officers. At least 640 appeals were filed with EC over the five days from Monday to Friday. Among these, as of 8:00 pm on Friday,

item.title: Trump urges US oil giants to repair Venezuela's 'rotting' energy industry
item.description: US President Donald Trump met with executives from some of the world's largest oil companies at the White House on Friday to discuss Venezuela, saying he wants them to invest $100 billion in the country to vastly expand its production.
